description: Marek Halden is appointed Chair of the Central Oversight Directorate, gaining authority over national civil compliance infrastructure and data coordination.
The Directorate launches the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) pilot in five test zones, using aggregated behavioral and transactional data to generate compliance risk scores.
Phase II of the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) begins, expanding passive data collection via commercial and telecom partners under new data-sharing agreements.
A closed Council session ends in impasse over expanding predictive enforcement tools; Halden is granted temporary discretion over related budgets.
A misclassification in the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) flags members of a foreign trade delegation, leading to a diplomatic complaint and internal inquiry.
Halden centralizes data access by rerouting enforcement system outputs through the Central Oversight Directorate, removing audit visibility from administrative offices.
A leaked voice clip, reportedly Halden criticizing military leadership, circulates on encrypted forums. No official verification or denial follows.
An undocumented update to the Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) engine is issued from Halden's secure terminal, adjusting thresholds for low-confidence behavioral flags.
Flagged individuals begin disappearing from BCI watchlists. A temporary data drift is suspected, but no root cause is identified.
Halden fails to attend a closed Directive Prioritization Meeting. Staff report last seeing him working late in his Tower 9 residence-office.
Halden is found deceased in his residence-office. No signs of struggle are present. Cardiac arrest is initially listed as the cause of death.
Toxicology reveals traces of a neuro-inhibitor compound used in certain psychiatric treatments. No investigation follows. Report is sealed.
A government bulletin announces the death of Councilor Marek Halden. No cause, successor, or further information is provided.
System-wide performance issues emerge due to missing encryption keys and access tokens linked to Halden's credentials; Behavioral Compliance Index (BCI) reporting is disrupted.
